definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: He thought by this little trick to elicit Butler's real name.
sentences.chinese: 他想利用这个小小的花巧办法诱出巴特勒的真姓名来。

sentences.english: Stick with waht you know, don't get too fancy.
sentences.chinese: 投资在你所认识的，不要太过花巧的东西。

sentences.english: Stick with what you know, don't get too fancy.
sentences.chinese: 投资在你所认识的，不要太过花巧的东西。

sentences.english: I have not been used to submit to any person's whims.
sentences.chinese: 任何人玩什么花巧，我都不会屈服。

definition: quick fix/opportune short cut (around a difficulty)/cheap trick (to get what one wants)/to pull a fast one
hand formed into a flat shape, as for a karate chop
pose or motion of one's body in martial arts
(to escape danger etc) by a hair's breadth (idiom)/in a critical state/on the brink of crisis/very close (to happening)/Taiwan pr. [jian4 bu4 rong2 fa3]
to resist/to ward off/to hold one's own/to receive guests
